intro: Centaurea cyaneum, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers, which bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Centaurea cyaneum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
